item.title: Wtf is wrong with this case now
item.dc:creator: @Olbrantz Olbrantz
item.description:
@Olbrantz wrote:

No you don’t. That’s the correct interface line #'s. Those numbers don’t give graphics buddy, they tell which line # you want that text to be displayed.

item.title: Wtf is wrong with this case now
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Here’s mine, just edit this around to what you need:

Also, it works, for me at least.

case 4: //Ranging sendFrame164(4443); sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a ranged level!", 4444); sendFrame126("Your ranged level is now "+playerLevel[4]+" .", 4445); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced a ranging level."); stillgfx(199, absY, absX); if (playerLevel[4] == 99) { sendMessage("Congratulations on getting Level 99 Ranging!"); addItem(3761, 1); }

Read full topic

item.title: Wtf is wrong with this case now
item.dc:creator: @Olbrantz Olbrantz
item.description:
@Olbrantz wrote:

Why do you need to change it? Isn’t that right? You need a break; at the end to close the case. Like this:

case 4: //Ranging sendFrame164(4443); stillgfx(199, absX, absY); sendFrame126("@gre@Awsome! you just advanced a ranged level!", 4444); sendFrame126("@whi@Your ranged level is now "+playerLevel[4]+" .", 4445); sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced a ranging level."); stillgfx(199, absY, absX); break;

Read full topic
item.source: Wtf is wrong with this case now

item.title: Wtf is wrong with this case now
item.dc:creator: @bmxr4c3r709 bmxr4c3r709
item.description:
@bmxr4c3r709 wrote:

case 4: //Ranging sendFrame164(4443); stillgfx(199, absX, absY); sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a ranged level!", 4444);<----DOESN'T SHOW THIS sendFrame126("Your ranged level is now "+playerLevel[4]+" .", 4445);<----DOESN"T SHOW THIS sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced a ranging level."); NpcDialogueSend = true; if (playerLevel[4] >= 99) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName +" has just gotten "+ playerLevel[4] +" ranged!"); }

I don’t know what to change the 4444 and 4445 to. Anyone got the right numbers?

Read full topic
